interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Il Volo
Review Date: 2014/01/14
Store: Il Volo  (Actor),     Ron de Moraes  (Director)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Music Videos & Concerts
Product Description: ["Italian heartthrobs Il Volo, the three Teenage Tenors filmed their October 27th live show at Detroit's famed Opera House. The show was produced by famed Grammy producer Ken Ehrlich and Il Volo's managers, Michele Torpedine (who discovered Andrea Bocelli) and Steve Leber are executive producers. Il Volo's PBS Special IL VOLO TAKES FLIGHT LIVE FROM THE DETROIT OPERA HOUSE had it's initial airing in Detroit on Dec. 7th. The response has been extremely positive, with over 26 markets confirmed to date that will be airing the special 3/3-3/14."]
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '24203166', 'Director': 'Ron de Moraes', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour', 'Release date': 'February 28, 2012', 'Actors': 'Il Volo', 'Studio': 'Geffen Records', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: These 3 young boys who started singing together at inception have developed into an accomplished singing trio of 3 young men. Their musical delivery in everything they sing reflects their God given gifts and the magnitude of their talent. I cannot say enough and when I first heard them live, a few years back I went out purchased everything they had put on cd and dvd. So close your eyes and listen to the miracle of song and singing that these three young men deliver and be enveloped by it all.
Review Title: Great Style, singing and powerful musical talent!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Verdi: La Traviata
Renee Fleming  (Actor),     Joseph Calleja  (Actor),     Richard Eyre  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, BBC, All BBC Titles
["Verdi's best-loved work, is performed here by a star cast in a revival of Richard Eyre's highly acclaimed 1994 production. Music Director Antonio Pappano conducts La traviata for the first time at Covent Garden. American oprano Renée Fleming returns to Covent Garden to sing Violetta for the first time with The Royal Opera. La traviata was first performed at the Teatro La Fenice, Venice in March 1853.", 'Press Reviews', '"Antonio Pappano takes charge of this revival, searching out the meaning of Verdi\'s score in a supple, sentient reading that sweeps you along."', '(The Guardian', ')', '"At the age of 50, [Fleming] still looks very good in the role of the doomed courtesan...[she] sounds good, too, singing with consistent skill...There\'s a sincerity to Maltese tenor Joseph Calleja\'s portrayal of Alfredo which gives it more spontaneity than his American colleagues supply...Stronger than the vocals is the conducting of Antonio Pappano, which possesses a natural stylishness and fluency. "', '(BBC Music Magazine', '★★★)', '"I was sniffy about her first night but this DVD comes from later in the run, by which time she had found an uncharacteristic emotional freedom. She is still the prima donna playing the part, but the beautiful sounds she makes, especially in the Act One finale and the Act Two party, are well worth hearing, and the high-quality film-work puts us right at the heart of the action. "', '(The Financial Times', '★★★★)', '"... this is a sensible, believable, attractive presentation that is more in line with Verdi than with the idiocies of Regietheater...Vocally, [Fleming] is on good form at almost every turn... Calleja must sound authentic enough as an Italianate tenor for anyone...I always have the impression that [Pappano] works with the singers rather than challenging them to a duel. The chorus and orchestra respond fittingly to his direction. "', '(International Record Review', ')', 'Cast', 'Renée Fleming', '(Violetta)', 'Joseph Calleja', '(Alfredo)', 'Thomas Hampson', '(Germont)', 'The Orchestra of the Royal Opera House; Antonio Pappano', 'Production', 'Company:', 'The Royal Opera', 'Stage Director:', 'Richard Eyre', 'Disc Information', 'Catalogue Number:', 'OA1040D', 'Date of Performance:', '2009', 'Running Time:', '135 minutes', 'Sound:', '2.0LPCM + 5.1(5.0) DTS', 'Aspect Ratio:', '16:9 Anamorphic', 'Subtitles:', 'EN, FR, DE, ES, IT', 'Label:', 'Opus Arte']
{'Genre': 'Music Video & Concerts, Classical / Opera & Vocal', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen, Classical', 'Contributor': 'Thomas Hampson, Richard Wiegold, Antonio Pappano, Joseph Calleja, Richard Eyre, Eddie Wade, Kostas Smoriginas, Renee Fleming, Royal Opera Chorus, Orchestra of the Royal Opera House, Monika-Evelin LiivThomas Hampson, Richard Wiegold, Antonio Pappano, Joseph Calleja, Richard Eyre, Eddie Wade, Kostas Smoriginas, Renee Fleming, Royal Opera Chorus, Orchestra of the Royal Opera House, Monika-Evelin Liiv  See more', 'Language': 'Italian', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'BOPU1040DVD', 'Director': 'Richard Eyre', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen, Classical', 'Run time': '2 hours and 34 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 31, 2011', 'Actors': 'Renee Fleming, Joseph Calleja, Thomas Hampson, Monika-Evelin Liiv, Eddie Wade', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, German, Spanish, Italian', 'Studio': 'Opus Arte', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Purchased as a gift for a birthday and she loved it.  Has watched it several times and music and clarity of musical display is superb.
La Traviata DVD

profile:
The user continues to demonstrate a strong affinity for classical music, particularly opera and vocal performances, with an evident enthusiasm for high-quality and emotionally resonant artistry. Their recent purchase and glowing five-star review of a performance by a renowned singing trio further emphasize their appreciation for exceptional vocal talent and orchestrations. This aligns with their established preference for immersive auditory experiences, showcasing a discerning taste for celebrated artists and productions.

The user's inclination towards gifting cultural experiences remains consistent, as they express a desire to share the profound impact of musical performances. Their focus on stylish delivery and powerful musicality reveals a deep appreciation for artists who showcase their talents effectively, enhancing their overall enjoyment of the genre.

The positive review emphasizes the user's habit of re-engaging with performances and valuing the emotional connection fostered through music. This ongoing interaction indicates a robust and evolving passion for opera and vocal performances, particularly those that feature emerging talents who resonate with their artistic standards. Overall, the user epitomizes a refined connoisseur of music, with an emphasis on quality, emotional depth, and the joy of sharing artistic experiences with others.
